Description.val:
The Medium Tactical Vehicles (MTV) Protection Kit Suite includes an Armor Kit and a Fuel Tank Fire Suppression (FTFS) system. The Armor Kit consists of applique armor panels that are mounted to the FMTV A-Cab exterior to further improve occupant survivability from attack. The FTFS is a ballistic fire protection system designed to cover the fuel tank on the LTAS FMTV. The MTV Protection Kit Suite provides occupant protection through enhanced tactical vehicle ballistic protection. ISO containers are inclusive to facilitate long term storage.  The Army Procurement Objective (APO) for Medium Tactical Vehicles (MTV) is 17,752.

The Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) Protection Kit program provides Armor Survivability Suite protection.  HTV Protection Kits include B-Kits (top and side armor for truck cabs), C-Kits (underbody armor for truck cabs), Fire Suppression, Fuel Tank Fire Suppression (FTFS) Blanket, Fuel Tank Self Sealant (FTSS), and Tank Armor Module (TAM) to enhance survivability.  The Armor Survivability Suite components are mounted to an A-Kit Heavy Tactical Vehicle; which includes Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck (HEMTT), Heavy Equipment Transporter System (HETS) Urban Survivability Kit (HUSK), Palletized Load System (PLS), Heavy Dump Truck (HDT), and Line Haul configurations to address numerous threats that the Department of Defense has identified.  The Armor Survivability Suite provides occupant protection through enhanced tactical vehicle ballistic protection. The Army Procurement Objective (APO) for Heavy Tactical Vehicles (HTV) is 9,207.

Protection kits were previously part of D15500 (Family of Medium Tactical Vehicles) and DA0500 (Family of Heavy Tactical Vehicles).

Justification.val:
FY 2019 Medium Tactical Vehicle (MTV) Protection Kit Base procurement dollars in the amount of $19.066 million procures 420 each Armor Kits to support Active Army units. This procurement will help achieve the Army's Tactical Wheeled Vehicle protection objectives and bring the Medium Tactical Vehicle (MTV) closer to the Army Tactical Wheeled Vehicle (TWV) strategy of 30% armor kits on hand and gives the Army greater flexibility to react to a contingency with the knowledge that Soldiers will have the best protection available.

FY 2019 Medium Tactical Vehicle (MTV) Protection Kit OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $19.262 million procures 424 each Armor Kits to support the European Deterrence Initiative.  

FY 2019 Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) Protection Kit Base procurement dollars in the amount of $19.062 million procures 161 each Palletized Load System (PLS) B-Kits and 12 each Heavy Equipment Transport System (HETS) Urban Survivability Kits (HUSK) to support Active Army units and Army Pre-positioned Stocks (APS).  Procurement of armor protection and maximizing use of armored vehicles equips deploying forces with the vehicles they require to perform their missions.  This procurement will bring the Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) closer to the Army Tactical Wheeled Vehicle (TWV) strategy of 30% armor kits on hand and gives the Army greater flexibility to react to a contingency with the knowledge that Soldiers will have the best protection available.

FY 2019 Heavy Tactical Vehicle (HTV) Protection Kit OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $30.738 million procures 569 each HEMTT B-Kits to support the European Deterrence Initiative (EDI).  This funding aligns with the Combatant Command (COCOM) requirement to deter potential adversaries and ensures that Active Army units can provide pre-positioned equipment sets. There is no excess inventory or viable substitutes available to support the EDI requirement. 

System Engineering/Program Management (SEPM) includes Program Management and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and provide contractor oversight.  Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training, and other government costs are included for retaining a professional acquisition workforce.

Gross Weapon System Unit Cost increase for D04017 from FY 2018 to FY 2019 is caused from the planned new procurement of the HETS Urban Survivability Kits (HUSK) at a higher unit cost as well as the test and documentation requirements for the weapon system.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced for $4.288 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
FY17 was the last ordering year for Ibis Tek. A follow on contract is to be determined upon completion of competitive bid process with target award date of Mar 2018.

Production rates are estimated until new contract award.

Name.val: Heavy Expanded Mobility Tactical Truck (HEMTT) B-Kits
Heavy Tactical Vehicle Protection Kits - HUSK Tooling

OverallHistoryPlanningRemarks.val:
FY17 was the last ordering year for Fidelity. A follow on contract is to be determined upon completion of competitive bid process with target award date of Aug 2018.
Production rates and lead times are estimated until new contract award.
